page.title: 09TRANSPORT IN AREA
page.content: Transport in the area is very much the responsibility of the individual. An area which years ago saw people moving almost exclusively by foot or horse now sees everyone moving by motor car. The only daily public transports are school buses to take children to Flyford School outside the area to the Middle School and High School at Pershore. A bus for Alcester goes through Abberton weekly whilst there is a daily return bus from Flyford to Worcester. All of this transport is run by private contractors. Almost complete lack of public transport facility again explains the reluctance of younger families to move into the area. At least one car per family is essential for taking part in any social activites especially concerning children. Exhaustion of fossil fuels could be a problem later.
